thread.title: VIRAL: Indonesian woman says she’s thankful for the gift of a new microphone, netizens let her know it’s a vibrator
thread.title_full: VIRAL: Indonesian woman says she’s thankful for the gift of a new microphone, netizens let her know it’s a vibrator

author: Coconuts Jakarta
title: VIRAL: Indonesian woman says she’s thankful for the gift of a new microphone, netizens let her know it’s a vibrator
text:
VIRAL: Indonesian woman says she’s thankful for the gift of a new microphone, netizens let her know it’s a vibrator By Coconuts Jakarta January 4, 2017 / 15:59 WIB Like Coconuts JKT on Facebook us Follow Coconuts JKT on Twitter us Follow 
Screenshot of the Facebook post via Tribun News. 0 
Can you tell the difference between a microphone and a vibrator? One Indonesian woman seemingly couldn’t, making her the subject of much mockery online. 
Tribun News today reported that a viral Facebook post went up on December 26 which includes a photo of two objects and a caption that says “Thank God, I got a power bank and a microphone as a gift.” The post has already been shared over 1,500 times. 
We can assure you that the photo above, which was censored by Tribun News, does not in fact show a power bank and a microphone. The larger item is almost certainly Fairy Wand Massager Multi-Speed Personal Massage Vibrator. 
Thousands of comments inevitably poured in, with many netizens teasing what they believe to be the woman’s naivety with comments like, “the mic is so cute and pink,” and “Why don’t you use the powerbank?” 
Tribun News kept the woman’s identity a secret to protect her online privacy. That said, we were easily able to find Facebook profile, which appears to be legitimate, and the controversial post is indeed still there on her personal wall. 
The question is, is OP hopelessly naïve or did she in fact know exactly what it was she was posting and this was also just a clever ploy to achieve internet fame? Well, considering that so many netizens have pointed out to her what the “mic” and “power bank” really are, and yet she still hasn’t removed the post, we’re leaning towards the latter. 
At either rate, let’s just assume it’s all in good fun and hope no overzealous conservative reports her to the authorities for spreading pornography and violating the Information and Electronic Transactions Act (UU ITE).
